mapper.sql: id, create_date, update_date, data_status, desp, name,code, province_id
mapper.select:
select
from t_city where 1 =1
and name like concat('%',#{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%')

select a.id, a.create_date, a.update_date, a.data_status, a.desp, a.name, a.code,a.province_id, b.name as provinceIdName from t_city a left join t_province b on a.province_id = b.id where 1 =1
and a.name like concat('%',#{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%')

select a.id, a.create_date, a.update_date, a.data_status, a.desp, a.name, a.code,a.province_id, b.name as provinceIdName from t_city a left join t_province b on a.province_id = b.id where a.id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.insert: insert into t_city (id, create_date, update_date, data_status, desp, name, province_id) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{dataStatus,jdbcType=SMALLINT}, #{desp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{provinceId,jdbcType=VARCHAR})

insert into t_city
id,
create_date,
update_date,
data_status,
desp,
name,
province_id,

mapper.update:
update t_city
create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
data_status = #{dataStatus,jdbcType=SMALLINT},
desp = #{desp,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
province_id = #{provinceId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update t_city set create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, data_status = #{dataStatus,jdbcType=SMALLINT}, desp = #{desp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, province_id = #{provinceId,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
